intro: Tinantia undata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Tinantia undata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
